contentrichtext.text: {{italic title}} {{Taxobox | name = ''Xanthoparmelia chlorochroa'' | image = | image_width = 200px | regnum = [[Fungi]] | divisio = [[Ascomycota]] | classis = [[Lecanoromycetes]] | ordo = [[Lecanorales]] | familia = [[Parmeliaceae]] | genus = ''[[Xanthoparmelia]]'' | species = '''''X. chlorochroa''''' | binomial = ''Xanthoparmelia chlorochroa'' | binomial_authority = ([[Edward Tuckerman|Tuck.]]) Hale (1974) | synonyms = <center>''Parmelia chlorochroa''<br><small>Tuck.</small></center> }} '''''Xanthoparmelia chlorochroa''''', commonly known as the '''tumbleweed shield lichen''', is a [[lichen]]ized species of fungus in the [[Parmeliaceae]] family. This lichen, abundant on the High Plains of [[Wyoming]], has been implicated in the poisoning of domestic sheep and cattle in that state during the 1930s, and then again in 2004.<ref name="isbn0-87071-394-9">{{cite book |author=Geiser, L, McCune B. |title=Macrolichens of the Pacific Northwest |publisher=Oregon State University Press |location=Corvallis |year=1997 |pages=|isbn=0-87071-394-9 |oclc= |doi= |accessdate=}}</ref> It has also been implicated in the poisonning of [[elk]] in 2004<ref>{{cite journal|last=Cook|first=Walter E.|coauthors=Raisbeck, Cornish, Williams, Brown, Hiatt and Kreeger|title=Paresis and Death in Elk (Cervus elaphus) Due to Lichen Intoxication in Wyoming|journal=Journal of Wildlife Diseases|year=2007|month=July|volume=43|issue=3|pages=498â€“503|url=http://www.jwildlifedis.org/content/43/3/498|accessdate=8 July 2012}}</ref> It has been used as a remedy for [[impetigo]] by the [[Navajo people|Navajo]].<ref name="urlXanthoparmelia chlorochroa">{{cite web |url=http://www.lichen.com/bigpix/Xchlorochroa.html |title=''Xanthoparmelia chlorochroa'' |work= |accessdate=2009-03-23}}</ref> ==Description== This lichen has a thallus that is foliose, or leafy in appearance. ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== * [http://www.indexfungorum.org/Names/NamesRecord.asp?RecordID=343880 Index Fungorum] {{DEFAULTSORT:Xanthoparmelia Chlorochroa}} [[Category:Xanthoparmelia|chlorochroa]] [[Category:Fungi of North America]] {{Lecanoromycetes-stub}}
